episode.content: In Trails to Oishii Tokyo, reporters from around the world discover Japan's best ingredients. This time, Japan's environmentally friendly, sustainable fishing methods. From single-line lures to giant fixed nets to nets thrown into rivers to catch freshwater fish, these methods help to preserve Japan's seafood, the pillar of its culinary culture.
episode.description: In Trails to Oishii Tokyo, reporters from around the world discover Japan's best ingredients. Today, the sustainable fishing methods used to catch Japan's seafood, the pillar of its culinary culture.
episode.subtitle: Sustainable Fishing
episode.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo

episode.content: On Trails to Oishii Tokyo, reporters from around the world explore Japan's unique ingredients. Often given as gifts, high-end Japanese fruits aren't only delicious, they have the visual appeal of radiant jewels. Researchers and farmers go to great lengths to ensure they're grown to the perfect shape and pigment. Join us on a journey in search of fabulous fruit.
episode.description: Often given as gifts, high-end Japanese fruits aren't only delicious, they have the visual appeal of radiant jewels. Join us in search of fabulous fruit.
episode.subtitle: Fabulous Fruit
episode.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo

episode.content: Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan's large northern island, is known for its rich nature and great, Oishii food. Its expansive farmlands, about a quarter of Japan's total, yield fresh produce, while its bountiful seas are home to some of Japan's best seafood, including fish, marine plants and more. And don't forget dairy: Hokkaido is Japan's largest producer! Today, we showcase the best of our Hokkaido trails so far.
episode.description: Hokkaido, Japan's large northern island, is known for nature and oishii food. It's home to fresh produce, bountiful seafood and delicious dairy. Today, we showcase the best of our Hokkaido trails!
episode.subtitle: Hokkaido Special
episode.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo

episode.content: Take a close look at unique herbs and spices, from the world-famous wasabi to the recently popular Sansho pepper. These small ingredients have played a massive role in the development of Japanese cuisine over the centuries, not only providing a punch of flavor but even disinfectant properties and health benefits. Join our reporters on a mouth-watering journey into the world of Japan's herbs and spices.
episode.description: From the world-famous wasabi to the rise of the "sansho" pepper, discover the herbs and spices essential in Japanese cuisine.
episode.subtitle: HERBS AND SPICES
episode.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo
